name: Perpetual Nomads (Institutional Version)
description:
Perpetual Nomads is the first Inanimate Alice Episode to be created in Virtual Reality. Written by Mez Breeze, Perpetual Nomads is a co-production between Mez Breeze Design (Australia) and Bradfield Narrative Designs (Canada) with investment from Canada Media Fund and Screen Australia. This version is for Institutional use only (including library/closed resource collections and 1:1 classroom use for up to 35 students and 1 teacher). For the standard retail version, please purchase it here.


This release includes both the PC and VR bundle – you can access both the VR and PC versions from the main menu after unzipping. The VR version requires a Vive or Rift headset, but not hand controllers, to play. Install instructions are included in the bundle.


Awards

  • In September 2019, Perpetual Nomads was shortlisted for the Public Library Prize for Electronic Literature.
  • In August 2018, Perpetual Nomads received an Honorable Mention in the Opening Up Digital Fiction Writing Competition.
  • In October 2017, the Beta version of Perpetual Nomads made the finals of the QUT Digital Literature Award in the 2017 Queensland Literary Awards.
  • In July 2017, the Beta version of Perpetual Nomads received an Honorable Mention in the Turn On Literature Prize.
  • In May 2017, the Beta version of Perpetual Nomads was shortlisted in the Opening Up Digital Fiction Writing Competition.
